F2.name: F2
F2.description: Root namespace of the F2 SDK

F2.AppHandlers.name: F2.AppHandlers
F2.AppHandlers.description:
The new `AppHandlers` functionality provides Container Developers a higher level of control over configuring app rendering and interaction.

The addition of `F2.AppHandlers` replaces the previous {{#crossLink "F2.ContainerConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} properties `beforeAppRender`, `appRender`, and `afterAppRender`. These methods were deprecated—but not removed—in version 1.2. They will be permanently removed in a future version of F2.

Starting with F2 version 1.2, `AppHandlers` is the preferred method for Container Developers to manage app layout.

### Order of Execution **App Rendering** 0. {{#crossLink "F2/registerApps"}}F2.registerApps(){{/crossLink}} method is called by the Container Developer and the following methods are run for *each* {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} passed. 1. **'appCreateRoot'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_CREATE\_ROOT*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. 2. **'appRenderBefore'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_RENDER\_BEFORE*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. 3. Each app's `manifestUrl` is requested asynchronously; on success the following methods are fired. 3. **'appRender'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_RENDER*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. 4. **'appRenderAfter'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_RENDER\_AFTER*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. **App Removal** 0. {{#crossLink "F2/removeApp"}}F2.removeApp(){{/crossLink}} with a specific {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig/instanceId "}}{{/crossLink}} or {{#crossLink "F2/removeAllApps"}}F2.removeAllApps(){{/crossLink}} method is called by the Container Developer and the following methods are run. 1. **'appDestroyBefore'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_DESTROY\_BEFORE*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. 2. **'appDestroy'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_DESTROY*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. 3. **'appDestroyAfter'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_DESTROY\_AFTER*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached. **Error Handling** 0. **'appScriptLoadFailed'** (*{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.APP\_SCRIPT\_LOAD\_FAILED*) handlers are fired in the order they were attached.

F2.Constants.AppHandlers.name: F2.Constants.AppHandlers
F2.Constants.AppHandlers.description: A convenient collection of all available appHandler events.

F2.App.name: F2.App
F2.App.description:
The App Class is an optional class that can be namespaced onto the 
{{#crossLink "F2\Apps"}}{{/crossLink}} namespace.  The 
[F2 Docs](../../app-development.html#app-class)
has more information on the usage of the App Class.

params.name: appConfig
params.description: The F2.AppConfig object for the app

params.name: root
params.description: The root DOM Element for the app

F2.AppConfig.name: F2.AppConfig
F2.AppConfig.description: The AppConfig object represents an app's meta data

F2.AppManifest.name: F2.AppManifest
F2.AppManifest.description: The assets needed to render an app on the page

F2.ContainerConfig.name: F2.ContainerConfig
F2.ContainerConfig.description:
An object containing configuration information for the
[container](../../container-development.html)

F2.Constants.name: F2.Constants
F2.Constants.description: Constants used throughout the Open Financial Framework

F2.Events.name: F2.Events
F2.Events.description:
Handles [Context](../../app-development.html#context) passing from
containers to apps and apps to apps.

classitems.description: Abosolutizes a relative URL

return.description:
URL
Source: https://gist.github.com/Yaffle/1088850
Tests: http://skew.org/uri/uri_tests.html

classitems.description: Parses URI
classitems.name: _parseURI

return.description:
string
Source: https://gist.github.com/Yaffle/1088850
Tests: http://skew.org/uri/uri_tests.html

classitems.description:
A function to pass into F2.stringify which will prevent circular
reference errors when serializing objects
classitems.name: appConfigReplacer

classitems.description:
The apps namespace is a place for app developers to put the javascript
class that is used to initialize their app. The javascript classes should
be namepaced with the {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}}.appId. 
It is recommended that the code be placed in a closure to help keep the
global namespace clean.

If the class has an 'init' function, that function will be called 
automatically by F2.
classitems.name: Apps

classitems.description:
Creates a namespace on F2 and copies the contents of an object into
that namespace optionally overwriting existing properties.
classitems.name: extend

params.name: ns
params.description:
The namespace to create. Pass a falsy value to 
add properties to the F2 namespace directly.

params.name: obj
params.description: The object to copy into the namespace.

params.name: overwrite
params.description: True if object properties should be overwritten

return.description: The created object

classitems.description: Generates a somewhat random id
classitems.name: guid

return.description: A random id

classitems.description: Search for a value within an array.
classitems.name: inArray

return.description: True if the item is in the array

classitems.description: Tests a URL to see if it's on the same domain (local) or not
classitems.name: isLocalRequest

return.description:
Whether the URL is local or not
Derived from: https://github.com/jquery/jquery/blob/master/src/ajax.js

classitems.description: Utility method to determine whether or not the argument passed in is or is not a native dom node.
classitems.name: isNativeDOMNode

params.name: testObject
params.description: The object you want to check as native dom node.

return.description: Returns true if the object passed is a native dom node.

classitems.description: A utility logging function to write messages or objects to the browser console. This is a proxy for the [`console` API](https://developers.google.com/chrome-developer-tools/docs/console).
classitems.name: log

params.name: Object/Method
params.description: An object to be logged _or_ a `console` API method name, such as `warn` or `error`. All of the console method names are [detailed in the Chrome docs](https://developers.google.com/chrome-developer-tools/docs/console-api).

classitems.description: Wrapper to convert a JSON string to an object
classitems.name: parse

return.description: The parsed object

classitems.description:
Wrapper to convert an object to JSON

**Note: When using F2.stringify on an F2.AppConfig object, it is
recommended to pass F2.appConfigReplacer as the replacer function in
order to prevent circular serialization errors.**
classitems.name: stringify

params.name: replacer
params.description:
An optional parameter that determines
how object values are stringified for objects. It can be a function or an 
array of strings.

params.name: space
params.description:
An optional parameter that specifies the
indentation of nested structures. If it is omitted, the text will be
packed without extra whitespace. If it is a number, it will specify the
number of spaces to indent at each level. If it is a string (such as '\t'
or ' '), it contains the characters used to indent at each level.

return.description: The JSON string

classitems.description: Function to get the F2 version number
classitems.name: version

return.description: F2 version number

classitems.description:
Allows Container Developer to retrieve a unique token which must be passed to
all `on` and `off` methods. This function will self destruct and can only be called 
one time. Container Developers must store the return value inside of a closure.
classitems.name: getToken
__f2GetToken

classitems.description: Allows F2 to trigger specific events internally.
classitems.name: __trigger

params.name: eventKey
params.description: The event to fire. The complete list of event keys is available in {{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description: Allows Container Developer to easily tell all apps to render in a specific location. Only valid for eventType `appRender`.
classitems.name: on

params.name: eventKey{.namespace}
params.description:
The event key used to determine which event to attach the listener to. The namespace is useful for removal 
purposes. At this time it does not affect when an event is fired. Complete list of event keys available in 
{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: element
params.description: Specific DOM element to which app gets appended.

classitems.description: Allows Container Developer to add listener method that will be triggered when a specific event occurs.
classitems.name: on

params.name: eventKey{.namespace}
params.description:
The event key used to determine which event to attach the listener to. The namespace is useful for removal 
purposes. At this time it does not affect when an event is fired. Complete list of event keys available in 
{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.

params.name: listener
params.description: A function that will be triggered when a specific event occurs. For detailed argument definition refer to {{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.

classitems.description: Allows Container Developer to remove listener methods for specific events
classitems.name: off

params.name: eventKey{.namespace}
params.description:
The event key used to determine which event to attach the listener to. If no namespace is provided all
 listeners for the specified event type will be removed.
 Complete list available in {{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}}.

example:
var _token = F2.AppHandlers.getToken();
	F2.AppHandlers.off(_token,'appRenderBefore');

classitems.description:
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}} )
classitems.name: APP_MANIFEST_REQUEST_FAIL

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appCreateRoot`. Identifies the create root method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}} )
classitems.name: APP_CREATE_ROOT

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appRenderBefore`. Identifies the before app render method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}} )
classitems.name: APP_RENDER_BEFORE

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appRender`. Identifies the app render method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}}, [appHtml](../../app-development.html#app-design) )
classitems.name: APP_RENDER

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appRenderAfter`. Identifies the after app render method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}} )
classitems.name: APP_RENDER_AFTER

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appDestroyBefore`. Identifies the before app destroy method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( appInstance )
classitems.name: APP_DESTROY_BEFORE

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appDestroy`. Identifies the app destroy method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( appInstance )
classitems.name: APP_DESTROY

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appDestroyAfter`. Identifies the after app destroy method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( appInstance )
classitems.name: APP_DESTROY_AFTER

classitems.description:
Equivalent to `appScriptLoadFailed`. Identifies the app script load failed method for use in AppHandlers.on/off. 
When bound using {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers/on"}}F2.AppHandlers.on(){{/crossLink}} the listener function passed will receive the 
following argument(s): ( {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}appConfig{{/crossLink}}, scriptInfo )
classitems.name: APP_SCRIPT_LOAD_FAILED

classitems.description: Class stubs for documentation purposes

An optional init function that will automatically be called when
{{#crossLink "F2/registerApps"}}F2.registerApps(){{/crossLink}} is called.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description:
An optional destroy function that will automatically be called when
{{#crossLink "F2/removeApp"}}F2.removeApp(){{/crossLink}} and subsequently
the {{#crossLink "F2.Constants.AppHandlers/APP_DESTROY:property"}}F2.Constants.AppHandlers.APP_DESTROY{{/crossLink}} AppHandler.
classitems.name: destroy

classitems.description:
The unique ID of the app. More information can be found
[here](../../app-development.html#f2-appid)
classitems.name: appId

classitems.description: An object that represents the context of an app
classitems.name: context

classitems.description: True if the app should be requested in a single request with other apps.
classitems.name: enableBatchRequests

classitems.description:
The height of the app. The initial height will be pulled from
the {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} object
classitems.name: height

classitems.description:
The unique runtime ID of the app.

**This property is populated during the
F2.{{#crossLink "F2/registerApps"}}{{/crossLink}} process**
classitems.name: instanceId

classitems.description:
The language and region specification for this container 
represented as an IETF-defined standard language tag,
e.g. `"en-us"` or `"de-de"`. This is passed during the 
F2.{{#crossLink "F2/registerApps"}}{{/crossLink}} process.
classitems.name: containerLocale

classitems.description:
The languages and regions supported by this app represented
as an array of IETF-defined standard language tags,
e.g. `["en-us","de-de"]`.
classitems.name: localeSupport

classitems.description:
The url to retrieve the {{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}}
object.
classitems.name: manifestUrl

classitems.description:
The recommended maximum width in pixels that this app should be run.
**It is up to the [container](../../container-development.html) to
implement the logic to prevent an app from being run when the maxWidth
requirements are not met.**
classitems.name: maxWidth

classitems.description:
The recommended minimum grid size that this app should be run. This
value corresponds to the 12-grid system that is used by the
[container](../../container-development.html). This property should be
set by apps that require a certain number of columns in their layout.
classitems.name: minGridSize

classitems.description:
The recommended minimum width in pixels that this app should be run. **It
is up to the [container](../../container-development.html) to implement
the logic to prevent an app from being run when the minWidth requirements
are not met.
classitems.name: minWidth

classitems.description: The name of the app
classitems.name: name

classitems.description:
The root DOM element that contains the app

**This property is populated during the
F2.{{#crossLink "F2/registerApps"}}{{/crossLink}} process**
classitems.name: root

classitems.description:
The array of {{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest.AppContent"}}{{/crossLink}}
objects
classitems.name: apps

classitems.description: Any inline javascript tha should initially be run
classitems.name: inlineScripts

classitems.description: Urls to javascript files required by the app
classitems.name: scripts

classitems.description: Urls to CSS files required by the app
classitems.name: styles

classitems.description: Arbitrary data to be passed along with the app
classitems.name: data

classitems.description: The string of HTML representing the app
classitems.name: html

classitems.description: A status message
classitems.name: status

classitems.description:
Allows the [container](../../container-development.html) to override how
an app's html is inserted into the page. The function should accept an
{{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} object and also a string of
html
classitems.name: afterAppRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

params.name: html
params.description: The string of html representing the app

return.description: The DOM Element surrounding the app

classitems.description:
Allows the [container](../../container-development.html) to wrap an app
in extra html. The function should accept an
{{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} object and also a string of
html. The extra html can provide links to edit app settings and remove an
app from the container. See
{{#crossLink "F2.Constants.Css"}}{{/crossLink}} for CSS classes that
should be applied to elements.
classitems.name: appRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

params.name: html
params.description: The string of html representing the app

classitems.description:
Allows the container to render html for an app before the AppManifest for
an app has loaded. This can be useful if the design calls for loading
icons to appear for each app before each app is loaded and rendered to
the page.
classitems.name: beforeAppRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

return.description: The DOM Element surrounding the app

classitems.description: True to enable debug mode in F2.js. Adds additional logging, resource cache busting, etc.
classitems.name: debugMode

classitems.description:
The default language and region specification for this container 
represented as an IETF-defined standard language tag,
e.g. `"en-us"` or `"de-de"`. This value is passed to each app
registered as `containerLocale`.
classitems.name: locale

classitems.description: Milliseconds before F2 fires callback on script resource load errors. Due to issue with the way Internet Explorer attaches load events to script elements, the error event doesn't fire.
classitems.name: scriptErrorTimeout

classitems.description:
Allows the container to fully override how the AppManifest request is
made inside of F2.
classitems.name: xhr

params.name: success
params.description:
The function to be called if the request
succeeds

params.name: error
params.description: The function to be called if the request fails

params.name: complete
params.description:
The function to be called when the request
finishes (after success and error callbacks have been executed)

return.description:
The XMLHttpRequest object (or an object that has
an `abort` function (such as the jqXHR object in jQuery) to abort the
request)

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override individual parts of the AppManifest
request.  See properties and methods with the `xhr.` prefix.
classitems.name: xhr

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override the request data type (JSON or JSONP)
that is used for the request
classitems.name: xhr.dataType

return.description: The request data type that should be used

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override the request method that is used (just
like the `type` parameter to `jQuery.ajax()`.
classitems.name: xhr.type

return.description: The request method that should be used

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override the url that is used to request an
app's F2.{{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}}
classitems.name: xhr.url

return.description: The url that should be used for the request

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override the script loader which requests
dependencies defined in the {{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: loadScripts

classitems.description:
Allows the container to override the stylesheet loader which requests
dependencies defined in the {{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}}.
classitems.name: loadStyles

classitems.description:
The APP class should be applied to the DOM Element that surrounds the
entire app, including any extra html that surrounds the APP\_CONTAINER
that is inserted by the container. See the 
{{#crossLink "F2.ContainerConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} object.
classitems.name: APP

classitems.description:
The APP\_CONTAINER class should be applied to the outermost DOM Element
of the app.
classitems.name: APP_CONTAINER

classitems.description:
The APP_SCRIPTS_LOADED event is fired when all the scripts defined in
the AppManifest have been loaded.
classitems.name: APP_SCRIPTS_LOADED

classitems.description:
The APP\_SYMBOL\_CHANGE event is fired when the symbol is changed in an
app. It is up to the app developer to fire this event.
Returns an object with the symbol and company name:

    { symbol: 'MSFT', name: 'Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ)' }
classitems.name: APP_SYMBOL_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The APP\_WIDTH\_CHANGE event will be fired by the container when the
width of an app is changed. The app's instanceId should be concatenated
to this constant.
Returns an object with the gridSize and width in pixels:

    { gridSize:8, width:620 }
classitems.name: APP_WIDTH_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The CONTAINER\_SYMBOL\_CHANGE event is fired when the symbol is changed
at the container level. This event should only be fired by the
container or container provider.
Returns an object with the symbol and company name:

    { symbol: 'MSFT', name: 'Microsoft Corp (NASDAQ)' }
classitems.name: CONTAINER_SYMBOL_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The CONTAINER\_WIDTH\_CHANGE event will be fired by the container when
the width of the container has changed.
classitems.name: CONTAINER_WIDTH_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The CONTAINER\_LOCALE\_CHANGE event will be fired by the container when
the locale of the container has changed. This event should only be fired by the
container or container provider.
Returns an object with the updated locale (IETF-defined standard language tag):

    { locale: 'en-us' }
classitems.name: CONTAINER_LOCALE_CHANGE

classitems.description:
The RESOURCE_FAILED_TO_LOAD event will be fired by the container when
it fails to load a script or style.
classitems.name: RESOURCE_FAILED_TO_LOAD

classitems.description: Appends the app's html to the DOM
classitems.name: _afterAppRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

return.description: The DOM Element that contains the app

classitems.description: Renders the html for an app.
classitems.name: _appRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

classitems.description:
Rendering hook to allow containers to render some html prior to an app
loading
classitems.name: _beforeAppRender
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

return.description: The DOM Element surrounding the app

classitems.description: Handler to inform the container that a script failed to load
classitems.name: _onScriptLoadFailure
classitems.deprecationMessage: This has been replaced with {{#crossLink "F2.AppHandlers"}}{{/crossLink}} and will be removed in v2.0

params.name: scriptInfo
params.description:
The path of the script that failed to load or the exception info
for the inline script that failed to execute

The new F2.AppConfig object, prepopulated with
necessary properties

return.description: The new F2.AppConfig object

classitems.name: _hasNonTextChildNodes

return.description: True if there are non-text children

classitems.description: Adds properties to the ContainerConfig object to take advantage of defaults

classitems.description: Checks if an element is a placeholder element
classitems.name: _isPlaceholderElement

return.description: True if the element is a placeholder

classitems.description: Has the container been init?

return.description: True if the container has been init

classitems.description: Instantiates each app from it's appConfig and stores that in a local private collection

return.description: True if the app is valid

return.description: True if the config is valid

return.description: An array of objects containing the appId

classitems.description: Gets the current locale defined by the container
classitems.name: getContainerLocale

return.description: IETF-defined standard language tag

classitems.description:
Initializes the container. This method must be called before performing
any other actions in the container.
classitems.name: init

classitems.description: Has the container been init?
classitems.name: isInit

return.description: True if the container has been init

classitems.description:
Automatically load apps that are already defined in the DOM. Elements will 
be rendered into the location of the placeholder DOM element. Any AppHandlers
that are defined will be bypassed.
classitems.name: loadPlaceholders

params.name: parentNode
params.description: The element to search for placeholder apps

classitems.description:
Begins the loading process for all apps and/or initialization process for pre-loaded apps.
The app will be passed the {{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}} object which will
contain the app's unique instanceId within the container. If the
{{#crossLink "F2.AppConfig"}}{{/crossLink}}.root property is populated the app is considered
to be a pre-loaded app and will be handled accordingly. Optionally, the
{{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}} can be passed in and those
assets will be used instead of making a request.
classitems.name: registerApps

params.name: appManifests
params.description:
An array of
{{#crossLink "F2.AppManifest"}}{{/crossLink}}
objects. This array must be the same length as the apps array that is
objects. This array must be the same length as the apps array that is
passed in. This can be useful if apps are loaded on the server-side and
passed down to the client.

classitems.description: Removes all apps from the container
classitems.name: removeAllApps

classitems.description: Removes an app from the container
classitems.name: removeApp

classitems.description:
Execute each of the listeners that may be listening for the specified
event name in order with the list of arguments.
classitems.name: emit

classitems.description:
Adds a listener that will execute n times for the event before being 
removed. The listener is invoked only the first time the event is 
fired, after which it is removed.
classitems.name: many

params.name: timesToListen
params.description:

Adds a one time listener for the event. The listener is invoked only
the first time the event is fired, after which it is removed.
